greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: (Digit sum of 3^n) mod n.
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
example: a(5) = 4 because digsum(3^5) mod 5 = digsum(243) mod 5 = 9 mod 5 = 4.
maple: read(transforms): A175435 := proc(n) return digsum(3^n) mod n: end proc: seq(A175435(n), n=1..50); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, Oct 09 2013
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 03 2010
